posts.post_content: Well, nothing much to say but amazing card. Path to exile, while it does cost less, is horrible early game card. the cost difference means next to nothing in the mid-late game, where path should be used anyway. If you path turn 1 or 2, you are giving the opponent a huge mana acceleration... not wise. Both have built in no-regeneration. Terminate sends to the graveyard, which can be more useful (for haunting echoes etc.) or less useful (if they have unearth/persist) depending. Then again, how can you compare cards in completely different colors? Different play styles, different uses. So although you may think that path to exile is better spot removal, which would you run in a B/R deck? Exactly. 5/5
posts.html:

posts.post_content: It sometimes feels like there are certain points in Magic where Wizards just decide they're going to fundamentally alter the paradigm of a certain card type. For example, they shook up the vanilla two-drop with [Watchwolf](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Watchwolf) and pushed "destroy with no regen" to a totally new level with this little beauty.
